pages.title: E-commerce Product Photos
pages.metaTitle: E-commerce Product Photo Requirements by Platform | MyImageUpscaler
pages.metaDescription: Exact image requirements for Amazon, eBay, Etsy, Shopify. Learn minimum sizes, aspect ratios, and how to upscale product photos to meet platform standards.
pages.intro: Every marketplace has specific image requirements. Here's exactly what you need for each platform and how to get there.
pages.description: Specific image requirements for major e-commerce platforms with guidance on how to meet them.

platformRequirements.notes: Product must fill 85% of frame. No watermarks, logos, or text on main image.
Up to 24 images per listing. No borders, watermarks, or promotional text.

platformRequirements.background: Your choice - lifestyle shots work well
platformRequirements.notes: First image is thumbnail. 5:4 ratio for shop icon.
Consistent sizing across products improves appearance. Automatic WebP conversion.
Enable image regeneration after changing thumbnail sizes.

commonProblems.solution: Upscale to at least 2000x2000px. Most supplier images are 500-800px - upscale 3-4x for zoom functionality.
commonProblems.howTo: Upload to upscaler, select 4x, download. A 500px image becomes 2000px.

commonProblems.solution: Amazon requires pure white (255,255,255). Use a background removal tool before upscaling.
commonProblems.howTo: Remove background first, add white background, then upscale if needed.

commonProblems.problem: Product doesn't fill enough of the frame
commonProblems.solution: Crop image before upscaling to center product. Then upscale to meet minimum size.
commonProblems.howTo: Crop to product with minimal margins, then upscale 2-4x to reach 2000px.

commonProblems.solution: AI upscaling preserves sharpness, but very low quality sources have limits. Use highest quality source available.
commonProblems.howTo: Request higher resolution from supplier, or enhance before upscaling.

workflow.title: Check source image size
workflow.description: Right-click image, check properties/dimensions. Note current size.

workflow.title: Calculate needed upscale factor
workflow.description: If source is 500px and you need 2000px, that's 4x upscaling.

workflow.title: Upscale image
workflow.description: Upload to upscaler, select appropriate factor, download result.

workflow.title: Verify output
workflow.description: Check final dimensions meet platform requirements. Verify text/logos remain sharp.

faq.question: What resolution do Amazon product images need?
faq.answer: Amazon requires minimum 1000x1000px, but recommends 2000x2000px or larger to enable zoom functionality. The zoom feature activates when hovering on images 1500px or larger.

faq.question: Can I use the same image on all platforms?
faq.answer: Yes, if you prepare for the most demanding requirements. Create 2000x2000px images on pure white background - these work on Amazon, eBay, and Etsy with cropping.

faq.question: Will upscaled images pass Amazon's quality check?
faq.answer: AI-upscaled images typically pass if the source wasn't extremely low quality. Avoid upscaling images smaller than 300px - request better source images from suppliers instead.

faq.question: How do I handle different aspect ratios?
faq.answer: Most platforms prefer 1:1 (square). If your product is rectangular, either add white space to make it square, or crop to fit. Amazon's main image must be square.

pages.title: Real Estate Photo Guidelines
pages.metaTitle: Real Estate Photo Requirements by Platform | MLS, Zillow, Realtor.com
pages.metaDescription: Image requirements for MLS, Zillow, Realtor.com, and Redfin. Learn optimal sizes, aspect ratios, and how to prepare listing photos.
pages.intro: Different real estate platforms have different image specifications. Here's what you need for the major listing sites.
pages.description: Specific image requirements for real estate listing platforms with guidance on meeting them.

platformRequirements.notes: Requirements vary by regional MLS. Check your local MLS guidelines. Most accept up to 50 photos.
Up to 200 photos. First photo appears in search results - make it count.
Syncs from MLS. Higher resolution images get priority in search rankings.
Emphasizes photo quality in listings. HDR photos perform well.

commonProblems.solution: Use our Photo Enhancer to improve exposure and shadows. Works well for interior shots.
commonProblems.howTo: Upload to Photo Enhancer, let AI auto-correct exposure, then upscale if needed.

commonProblems.solution: Distortion correction should be done before upscaling. Most editing apps have lens correction.
commonProblems.howTo: Apply lens correction in Lightroom/Photos app first, then upscale the corrected image.

commonProblems.problem: Images from older phone are too small
commonProblems.solution: Upscale 2x for 2-3 year old phones, 3-4x for older phones to meet current standards.
commonProblems.howTo: A 1080x810px image upscaled 2x becomes 2160x1620px - above Zillow's recommended size.

photographyTips.description: Early morning or late afternoon light is most flattering. Avoid harsh midday shadows.
Allows longer exposure for brighter interiors without blur. Essential for low-light rooms.
Exterior photos work best in morning light. Schedule shoot to start outside.
Remove clutter, personal items, and distracting objects. Less is more.

faq.question: What's the best photo size for Zillow?
faq.answer: Zillow recommends 2048x1536px minimum. Larger images (up to 50MB) display better on large screens and mobile pinch-to-zoom.

faq.question: Should I use HDR for real estate photos?
faq.answer: HDR helps with interior shots where windows are bright but rooms are dark. Use natural-looking HDR, not over-processed styles.

faq.question: How many photos should a listing have?
faq.answer: 25-50 photos is optimal for most properties. Include exterior, all rooms, key features, and neighborhood context.

faq.question: Can I upscale photos taken with an old phone?
faq.answer: Yes, but quality depends on the source. iPhone 6 era photos (2-3MP) can upscale reasonably to 4-6MP. Very old photos have limits.

pages.title: Social Media Image Sizes
pages.metaTitle: Social Media Image Size Guide 2025 | Instagram, Facebook, Twitter, LinkedIn
pages.metaDescription: Complete guide to social media image dimensions. Optimal sizes for Instagram, Facebook, Twitter, LinkedIn, TikTok, and Pinterest with exact pixel dimensions.
pages.intro: Every platform has different optimal image sizes. Here are the exact dimensions for each platform in 2025.
pages.description: Complete reference for social media image dimensions with platform-specific requirements.

platformRequirements.notes: Portrait (4:5) gets more screen real estate in feeds. Stories are 9:16 vertical.
Cover photo displays differently on mobile (640x360px visible area). Center important content.
16:9 images display best in timeline. Square images get cropped.
Professional photos perform better. Avoid filters and heavy effects.
Vertical 9:16 is required. Horizontal content gets letterboxed.
2:3 vertical pins perform best. Taller pins get more visibility in feed.

upscalingGuide.solution: Upscale 2x to 1280x960px, then crop to square 960x960px, upscale to 1080x1080px
Upscale 2x to 1500x1000px, add padding or crop to 16:9 aspect ratio
Upscale to 1200x1200px, add vertical space above/below for 2:3 ratio

faq.question: What's the best size for Instagram posts?
faq.answer: 1080x1350px (4:5 portrait) takes up the most feed space. 1080x1080px (square) is also standard. Avoid landscape - it appears smaller in feeds.

faq.question: Why do my images look blurry on Instagram?
faq.answer: Instagram compresses images. Upload at exactly 1080px width to avoid resampling. Higher resolution images get downscaled and can lose sharpness.

faq.question: Should I upscale images for social media?
faq.answer: Upscale if your source is below platform minimums. But don't upscale beyond platform recommendations - a 4000px image will be compressed to 1080px anyway.

faq.question: What format should I use?
faq.answer: JPEG for photos (smaller file, good enough quality). PNG for graphics with text or transparency. All platforms accept both.

pages.title: Print Size Guide
pages.metaTitle: Image Resolution for Printing Guide | DPI Calculator & Size Chart
pages.metaDescription: Calculate exact pixel dimensions for any print size. DPI requirements, paper sizes, and how to prepare images for professional printing.
pages.intro: Print requires higher resolution than screen display. Here's exactly what you need for different print sizes.
pages.description: Complete guide to preparing images for print with DPI requirements and size calculations.

dpiExplanation.title: Understanding DPI
dpiExplanation.content: DPI (Dots Per Inch) determines print quality. Standard photo printing requires 300 DPI. Lower DPI results in visible pixels. Higher DPI offers no visible benefit but increases file size.

calculationFormula.title: Calculate Required Pixels
calculationFormula.example: For 8x10 inch print at 300 DPI: 8×300 = 2400 pixels wide, 10×300 = 3000 pixels tall

upscalingForPrint.solution: Already sufficient - no upscaling needed. Crop to 4:5 aspect ratio.
Upscale 4x to 3200x2400px, crop to 2400x3000px or add canvas space.
Upscale 8x to 8640x8640px. Quality may be limited - consider 150 DPI for large format.

printingTips.tip: Use sRGB color profile for consumer printing
printingTips.description: Most consumer printers and print services expect sRGB. Convert from Adobe RGB if needed.
Add 0.125 inches (37.5 pixels at 300 DPI) to each edge for professional prints with full bleed.

printingTips.tip: Proof on screen at actual size
printingTips.description: View at 100% zoom to check for visible pixels or artifacts before printing.

printingTips.tip: Save as TIFF or high-quality JPEG
printingTips.description: TIFF is lossless. If using JPEG, export at 95-100% quality to avoid compression artifacts.

faq.question: What DPI do I need for printing photos?
faq.answer: 300 DPI is the standard for photo prints up to 16x20 inches. For larger prints viewed from distance (posters, banners), 150-200 DPI is acceptable.

faq.question: Can I upscale a small image for a large print?
faq.answer: AI upscaling works well for 2-4x enlargement. Beyond that, quality depends on source. A 1000px image can reasonably become a 4000px (8x10 at 300 DPI) print.

faq.question: Why does my print look pixelated?
faq.answer: Insufficient resolution. Check if your source image has enough pixels for the print size at 300 DPI. Use the chart above to verify.

faq.question: What's the maximum print size for my image?
faq.answer: Divide pixel dimensions by 300 for max size at full quality. A 3000x2000px image prints at 10x6.7 inches at 300 DPI, or 20x13.3 inches at 150 DPI.

pages.title: Old Photo Restoration
pages.metaTitle: How to Restore Old Photos | Scanning & Enhancement Guide
pages.metaDescription: Complete guide to restoring old and damaged photos. Scanning tips, enhancement workflow, and realistic expectations for photo restoration.
pages.intro: Restoring old photos involves multiple steps: proper scanning, enhancement, and realistic expectations about what's possible.
pages.description: Step-by-step guide to restoring old and damaged photos with realistic expectations.

steps.title: Clean the scanner bed
steps.description: Dust and fingerprints on the glass will appear in your scan. Use microfiber cloth.

steps.title: Handle photos carefully
steps.description: Old photos are fragile. Use cotton gloves if available. Don't force bent photos flat.

steps.title: Scan at 600 DPI minimum
steps.description: Higher resolution gives more detail to work with. 1200 DPI for severely damaged photos.

steps.title: Scan as TIFF, not JPEG
steps.description: TIFF is lossless and preserves all detail. Convert to JPEG only after editing.

steps.title: Scan in color, even for B&W
steps.description: Color scanning captures subtle tones that help with restoration.

damageTypes.description: Colors have shifted or faded over time
damageTypes.canFix: Yes - AI can restore original color balance and saturation
damageTypes.limitations: Severely faded images may lack detail to recover

damageTypes.description: Physical damage visible as lines or marks
damageTypes.canFix: Partial - AI can reduce visibility, not fully remove
damageTypes.limitations: Deep scratches or creases through faces are difficult

damageTypes.description: Image lacks sharpness or was out of focus
damageTypes.canFix: Partial - moderate blur can be improved
damageTypes.limitations: Severe blur cannot be fully fixed - the detail wasn't captured

damageTypes.description: Parts of the photo are torn or missing
damageTypes.canFix: No - AI cannot reconstruct missing image data
damageTypes.limitations: Requires manual retouching by a professional

damageTypes.canFix: Partial - color correction helps, but texture loss is permanent
damageTypes.limitations: Areas where emulsion is lifted can't be recovered

restorationWorkflow.title: Scan at high resolution
restorationWorkflow.description: 600+ DPI as TIFF. This is your master file - don't edit the original.

restorationWorkflow.title: Make a working copy
restorationWorkflow.description: Duplicate the scan. Work on the copy, keep the original untouched.

restorationWorkflow.title: Crop and straighten
restorationWorkflow.description: Remove borders, scanner artifacts. Straighten if photo was scanned crooked.

restorationWorkflow.title: Run through Photo Enhancer
restorationWorkflow.description: AI enhancement improves color, reduces noise, and sharpens details.

restorationWorkflow.title: Upscale if needed
restorationWorkflow.description: If you need larger dimensions, upscale after enhancement for best quality.

restorationWorkflow.title: Export appropriately
restorationWorkflow.description: TIFF for archival, high-quality JPEG for sharing and printing.

realisticExpectations.title: What AI Restoration Can and Cannot Do
canDo: Improve color balance and remove yellowing
Sharpen soft focus and add apparent detail
cannotDo: Remove deep scratches or creases perfectly
Add detail that was never captured
Restore photos that are almost completely destroyed

faq.question: Can you restore a torn photo?
faq.answer: AI can't reconstruct missing sections. For torn photos, the sections must be scanned together and manually aligned, then retouched by hand. AI can then enhance the combined result.

faq.question: What resolution should I scan old photos?
faq.answer: Minimum 600 DPI for standard photos. 1200 DPI for small prints or those with fine detail. Higher is better - you can always downscale later.

faq.question: Should I restore color to black and white photos?
faq.answer: That's colorization, a different process. Our tools enhance existing content - we don't add color to B&W. Colorization AI is a separate category.

faq.question: How much improvement can I expect?
faq.answer: Moderately damaged photos see significant improvement. Severely damaged photos will look better but won't become perfect. Very old photos (pre-1900) have inherent limitations.

pages.title: Amazon Product Photo Upscaling
pages.metaTitle: Upscale Product Photos for Amazon Listings | MyImageUpscaler
pages.metaDescription: Meet Amazon's 2000x2000px image requirement with AI upscaling. Turn supplier photos into zoom-ready product images. Free tool, no watermarks.
pages.intro: Amazon requires minimum 1000x1000px images and recommends 2000x2000px for zoom. Here's how to upscale supplier photos to meet these requirements.
pages.description: Complete guide to preparing product images for Amazon listings, including size requirements, white background standards, and AI upscaling workflow.

platformRequirements.notes: Product must fill 85% of frame. No text, logos, watermarks, or borders.
Can show product in use, packaging, size comparison, and infographics.
Higher resolution images display better on desktop and mobile A+ modules.

commonProblems.solution: Use AI upscaling to enlarge 3-4x. A 500px image becomes 2000px with zoom capability.
commonProblems.howTo: Upload supplier image, select 4x upscale, download at 2000x2000px or larger.

commonProblems.problem: Images rejected for not meeting 1000px minimum
commonProblems.solution: Upscale first, then crop to square 1:1 ratio if needed.
commonProblems.howTo: Upscale to at least 1200px, then crop to 1000x1000px or 2000x2000px square.

commonProblems.problem: Zoom feature not working on listing
commonProblems.solution: Amazon zoom requires 1500px minimum on longest side, recommends 2000px+.
commonProblems.howTo: Upscale all product images to 2000x2000px to ensure zoom works.

commonProblems.problem: Product details look blurry after upscaling
commonProblems.solution: AI upscaling preserves text and fine details unlike traditional resizing.
commonProblems.howTo: Use AI upscaler specifically trained for product photography and text preservation.

workflow.title: Audit source image quality
workflow.description: Check original dimensions. Images under 300px may not upscale well for Amazon.

workflow.title: Remove or replace background
workflow.description: For main image, ensure pure white background (255,255,255) before upscaling.

workflow.title: Upload to AI upscaler
workflow.description: Select 4x upscale for 500px images, 2x for 1000px images to reach 2000px target.

workflow.title: Crop to 1:1 ratio
workflow.description: Ensure final image is square with product filling 85% of frame.

workflow.title: Verify file size and format
workflow.description: Save as JPEG under 10MB. Use 85-95% quality for best size/quality balance.

faq.question: What image size does Amazon require for product photos?
faq.answer: Amazon requires minimum 1000x1000px but strongly recommends 2000x2000px or larger. The zoom feature only activates on images 1500px or larger on the longest side, and 2000px+ provides the best customer experience.

faq.question: Can I upscale dropshipping supplier photos for Amazon?
faq.answer: Yes, AI upscaling works well for supplier photos typically ranging from 500-800px. Upscale 3-4x to reach Amazon's 2000px recommendation. Ensure you have rights to use the images commercially.

faq.question: Will upscaled images pass Amazon's quality check?
faq.answer: AI-upscaled images typically pass Amazon's automated checks if the source wasn't extremely low quality. Focus on source images above 300px for best results. Product details and text remain sharp through the upscaling process.

faq.question: Why do my Amazon images not have zoom?
faq.answer: Amazon's zoom feature requires images to be at least 1500px on the longest side, with 2000px+ recommended. Upscale your images to 2000x2000px to ensure zoom works for all customers.

faq.question: What's the best format for Amazon product images?
faq.answer: JPEG is preferred for most product photos due to smaller file sizes. Use 85-95% quality setting. PNG is better only if you need transparency (though Amazon main images require white backgrounds anyway).

pages.title: Real Estate Photo Enhancement
pages.metaTitle: Enhance Real Estate Photos with AI | Property Listing Images
pages.metaDescription: Transform property photos with AI enhancement. Fix lighting, upscale resolution, and make listings stand out. Used by agents and photographers.
pages.intro: Professional-looking listing photos sell properties faster. Enhance and upscale property images to meet MLS standards and outshine the competition.
pages.description: Comprehensive guide to enhancing real estate photos for MLS, Zillow, and other property listing platforms using AI tools.

platformRequirements.notes: Higher quality photos get more views. Many MLS systems now support HD images.
First photo is crucial - it appears in search results. High-res images rank better.
Higher resolution images receive priority placement in search results.
Quality photos directly impact listing views and inquiries.

commonProblems.solution: AI enhancement automatically corrects exposure and brings out shadow detail.
commonProblems.howTo: Upload to photo enhancer, let AI auto-correct, then upscale if resolution is insufficient.

commonProblems.solution: Upscale 2-3x to meet modern standards. A 1200px photo becomes 2400-3600px.
commonProblems.howTo: Upload to AI upscaler, select 2x or 3x, verify output meets platform requirements.

commonProblems.solution: AI enhancement can recover some window detail and balance interior/exterior exposure.
commonProblems.howTo: Run through enhancer first, then upscale the corrected image.

commonProblems.problem: Photos from previous agent are low quality
commonProblems.solution: Enhance and upscale existing photos while scheduling new professional photography.
commonProblems.howTo: Process batch through enhancer and upscaler to improve immediately.

photographyTips.tip: Shoot during golden hour for exteriors
photographyTips.description: Early morning or late afternoon provides flattering natural light without harsh shadows.
Even during day shoots, interior lights add warmth and make spaces feel inviting.

photographyTips.tip: Use a tripod for consistent results
photographyTips.description: Tripod allows longer exposures for brighter interiors and ensures level horizons.

photographyTips.tip: Shoot from corners for maximum space
photographyTips.description: Shooting from room corners shows two walls and makes spaces appear larger.
Remove personal items, close toilet lids, arrange furniture to show traffic flow.

workflow.title: Assess existing photo quality
workflow.description: Check resolution, exposure, and composition. Identify which images need enhancement vs. reshoot.

workflow.title: Run AI enhancement first
workflow.description: Upload to photo enhancer to fix exposure, color balance, and clarity before upscaling.

workflow.title: Upscale to target resolution
workflow.description: Enlarge enhanced photos to 2048px or higher for optimal display on listing sites.

workflow.title: Export in correct format
workflow.description: Save as JPEG at 85-95% quality. Most MLS systems require JPEG format.

workflow.title: Order photos strategically
workflow.description: Lead with best exterior shot, then key rooms. First photo appears in search results.

faq.question: Can AI enhancement replace professional real estate photography?
faq.answer: AI enhancement dramatically improves existing photos but doesn't replace professional photography for high-value listings. Use enhancement to improve good photos or as a temporary solution while scheduling a professional shoot.

faq.question: What resolution should real estate photos be?
faq.answer: Aim for 2048x1536px minimum. This meets requirements for Zillow, MLS, and Realtor.com while providing sharp images on both desktop and mobile. Higher resolution (2560px+) can improve search ranking on some platforms.

faq.question: How do I fix dark interior photos?
faq.answer: AI photo enhancement automatically corrects exposure and brightens shadows. Upload your dark interior shot, let the AI analyze and correct, then download the improved version. For best results, enhance before upscaling.

faq.question: Will enhanced photos look fake or over-processed?
faq.answer: Quality AI enhancement produces natural-looking results. Avoid tools that create the over-saturated, HDR-heavy look that buyers distrust. Our enhancer prioritizes realistic corrections over dramatic effects.

faq.question: How many photos should a real estate listing have?
faq.answer: 25-50 photos is optimal for most properties. Include exterior, all main rooms, key features (kitchen, bathrooms, closets), and any unique selling points. Quality matters more than quantity - 25 great photos beat 50 mediocre ones.

Upscale to match your screen resolution. 4K monitors need 3840px+ width.

commonProblems.solution: AI upscalers trained on anime preserve flat color areas better than general-purpose tools.

commonProblems.solution: Quality anime upscaling maintains crisp lines without ghosting or blur.

commonProblems.problem: JPEG artifacts become more visible after upscaling

faq.question: What's the best upscaler for anime images?
faq.answer: AI upscalers work best for anime because they understand the characteristics of drawn content - flat colors, clean lines, and specific shading styles. Traditional upscaling makes anime look blurry, while AI maintains the crisp aesthetic.

faq.question: Can I upscale old anime screenshots to 4K?
faq.answer: Yes, but results vary by source quality. Modern anime (post-2010) upscales excellently. Older anime (1990s-2000s) works well with some minor artifacts. Very old anime (1980s) may show visible limitations. Start with 2x and assess quality.

faq.question: How do I upscale manga without losing detail?
faq.answer: AI upscaling preserves line art and screentones that define manga. For best results: scan at 600+ DPI if digitizing yourself, clean dust/scratches before upscaling, and use 2x-4x scale factor. PNG format preserves quality better than JPEG.

faq.question: Will upscaling remove JPEG artifacts from anime images?
faq.answer: AI upscaling can reduce JPEG compression artifacts while enlarging. However, heavily compressed sources will still show some artifacts. For best results, find the highest quality source available - PNG preferred, high-quality JPEG acceptable.

faq.question: What resolution should anime wallpapers be?
faq.answer: Match your screen: 1920x1080 for 1080p displays, 2560x1440 for 1440p, and 3840x2160 for 4K. Phone wallpapers typically need 1080x2400 for modern devices. Upscale your source to these target resolutions.

faq.question: Is there a free anime upscaler?
faq.answer: Yes, our AI upscaler handles anime images for free with no watermarks. You can upscale anime screenshots, manga panels, and digital art up to 4x without paying. Premium plans offer batch processing and higher file size limits.

faq.question: What's the best upscaler for cartoon images?

faq.question: Can I upscale old comic book panels?
faq.answer: Yes! AI upscaling works well with comic book panels, whether scanned from print or digital sources. For best results with scans, clean dust and scratches first, then upscale starting at 2x.

faq.question: Will upscaling damage the art style?
faq.answer: No, our AI upscaler is designed to preserve artistic style including line quality, color choices, and overall appearance. The enhancement adds detail without changing the artist's intent.

faq.question: What's the maximum resolution for cartoon wallpapers?

faq.question: Is there a free cartoon upscaler?

bestPractices: Start with Face Restore for general improvements
Use Face Pro for professional headshots and critical portraits
Select Ultra tier for large format printing needs
Ensure good lighting in source photos for best results
Avoid extreme upscaling (8x) for very low quality sources

faq.question: What's the difference between Face Restore and Face Pro?
faq.answer: Face Restore (2 credits) uses GFPGAN for photo restoration with facial feature reconstruction. Face Pro (6 credits) uses Flux-2-Pro for premium portrait enhancement with advanced detail improvement. Face Pro delivers superior results for professional portraits.

faq.question: Can portrait upscaler fix blurry faces?
faq.answer: Yes! Our face enhancement models specialize in reconstructing facial details from blurry or low-quality photos. Results vary based on source quality, but significant improvement is typical for moderately blurry images.

faq.question: Will my portraits look unnatural or plastic?
faq.answer: Our AI models are designed to maintain natural appearance. Skin texture and features are enhanced while preserving realistic characteristics. For subtle results, Face Restore is recommended over Face Pro.

faq.question: What resolution can portrait photos be upscaled to?
faq.answer: With Ultra quality tier, portraits can be upscaled to 4K or 8K resolution (up to 8192x8192px). This is ideal for large format printing or professional use.

faq.question: Is there a free portrait upscaler?
faq.answer: Yes! The Free tier includes Face Restore quality (2 credits = 1 image) and Quick quality (1 credit = 1 image). You can enhance portrait photos with no watermarks. For frequent use, paid tiers offer more credits and batch processing.

faq.question: Can I upscale multiple portraits at once?
faq.answer: Batch processing is available on paid tiers (Starter: 5 images, Hobby: 10 images, Pro: 50 images, Business: 500 images per batch). Free tier processes single images only.

pages.title: Product Photo Background Removal
pages.metaTitle: Remove Backgrounds from Product Photos | E-commerce Images
pages.metaDescription: Remove backgrounds from product photos for Amazon, eBay, Etsy, and Shopify. Create white backgrounds that meet marketplace requirements. Free AI tool.
pages.h1: Product Photo Background Removal for E-commerce
pages.intro: Create professional product images with clean white backgrounds that meet marketplace requirements. Our AI removes complex backgrounds while preserving product details.
pages.description: Professional product photo preparation for online marketplaces. Remove busy backgrounds and create clean, white backgrounds that meet Amazon, eBay, and Etsy requirements.
challenges: Marketplace requirements demand pure white (255,255,255) backgrounds
Product shadows and reflections need to be preserved or removed cleanly
Complex product shapes with holes or transparent parts are difficult
Consistent background across entire product catalog is essential

solutions.problem: Busy or cluttered backgrounds distract from products
solutions.solution: AI instantly removes backgrounds and replaces with pure white

solutions.problem: Manual editing is time-consuming for large catalogs
solutions.solution: Batch processing removes backgrounds from multiple images at once
AI preserves fine details and creates clean, professional edges

results.description: Remove backgrounds in seconds vs. minutes with manual editing
Pure white backgrounds meet Amazon and eBay requirements
No subscription fees for unlimited background removal

faq.question: Does this create Amazon-compliant white backgrounds?
faq.answer: Yes, our background remover creates pure white (RGB 255,255,255) backgrounds that meet Amazon's main image requirements. The product is isolated cleanly for a professional marketplace appearance.

faq.question: Can it handle products with complex shapes?
faq.answer: The AI handles complex shapes including products with holes, transparent parts, and intricate edges. Results are best with clear contrast between product and background.

faq.question: How do I process many product photos at once?
faq.answer: While the free tool processes one image at a time, you can quickly cycle through your catalog. For bulk operations, API access is available for automated workflows.

faq.question: Will it preserve product shadows?
faq.answer: The AI removes background completely, including shadows. For product photos with natural shadows, you may want to add a subtle drop shadow after removal for a polished look.

pages.title: Portrait Background Removal
pages.metaTitle: Remove Background from Portrait Photos | Headshot Editing
pages.metaDescription: Remove backgrounds from portraits and headshots with AI. Professional results with hair detail preservation. Free online tool for LinkedIn, resumes, and more.
pages.intro: Transform casual photos into professional headshots by removing distracting backgrounds. Our AI preserves complex hair details and creates clean cutouts.
pages.description: Professional portrait and headshot preparation with AI background removal. Perfect for LinkedIn profiles, resumes, ID photos, and professional branding.
challenges: Hair and fine edges are notoriously difficult to cut out cleanly
Professional photo editing software has steep learning curves
Hiring photographers or editors for simple headshots is expensive
Consistent background style across team photos requires skill

solutions.problem: Hair creates messy edges with traditional selection tools
solutions.solution: AI specifically trained to handle fine hair details and wispy edges

solutions.problem: Need professional headshot but only have casual photo
solutions.solution: Remove casual background and replace with solid color for professional look
Remove all backgrounds and apply consistent style across team

results.description: AI handles wispy hair, curls, and fine strands without halo effects
Transform any portrait to professional quality instantly
Professional headshot editing at no cost

faq.question: Will it handle curly or frizzy hair?
faq.answer: Yes, our AI is specifically trained to handle all hair types including curly, frizzy, and wispy hair. The model detects fine strands and preserves natural-looking edges without the halo effect common in traditional tools.

faq.question: Can I use this for LinkedIn profile photos?
faq.answer: Absolutely. Remove your current background and either keep it transparent or add a solid professional color. The result is a clean, professional headshot perfect for LinkedIn.

faq.question: What about glasses and reflections?
faq.answer: The AI handles glasses well, preserving the frames and lenses. Strong reflections in glasses may show some edge artifacts, but most eyewear is processed cleanly.

faq.question: Is this suitable for ID or passport photos?
faq.answer: Yes, you can remove backgrounds and add compliant white or blue backgrounds. Note that official ID photos may have specific lighting and composition requirements beyond background color.
